Reviews.Title: “Fourth visit and I'll recommend this place again.”
Reviews.Author: Nan N
Reviews.Content: We stayed her again in September 2011 for five nights and I'll recommend it again. I don't work for this motel or receive any commission for giving them good reviews but I really don't understand why all of the bad reviews of this place. As motels go I think it is really good and I am quite picky. The motel was quite busy this time. The parking lot was full as was the motel but it was not noisy at night. We didn't bother to reserve this time because we were on a driving holiday and weren't sure exactly when we'd get to SD. We basically rolled in after dark and got the last room available, ground floor right in front of the pool. Our coffee pot was broken and the fridge didn't work when we arrived. I went to the evening desk clerk and told him. He gave me a new coffee pot right then and there and someone came and fixed the fridge promptly the next morning. The microwave worked fine... we warmed up our continental breakfast from the lobby in it. The orange juice and apple juice are a nice additional thing that this place give with their 'lobby' breakfast. Many places just have pan dulce or bagel and coffee. The room was clean again, linens in good condition and clean and the room had no bugs. I've stayed in four different king size bed rooms here now and they have all been the same, spacious with a love seat and coffee table at the entrance, bed beyond and a large closet. The motel for sure isn't downtown but if you have a vehicle old town, Coronado (my favorite beach) and other SD attractions are all within easy driving range. It is also convenient for entering or arriving from Mexico whether through one of the southern California border crossings or if using I-8 to or from Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “This was the third visit to this Days Inn, I'll stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: Nan N
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times now, November 2010, April 2011 and June 2011. The location is really convenient for us, close to the freeway to downtown or the beach towns to the north and also close to the border. The rooms are clean and have king size beds which is nice and also a fridge and a coffee maker which is great for cold beverages, coffee and tea. The management is friendly and the hotel is very quiet even though it is just a bit off the freeway. Good value and every bit as convenient as the down town hotel we stayed in also last April.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kllrmom
Reviews.Content: The check in was something out of the stone age. Room smells like urine and lysol. Bathroom still had hair in the shower, dead ants on the wall and no way to stop the bathtub if anyone is brave enough to sit in that DISGUSTING tub. We were supposed to be here four days, checked out after one night. The "hot" breakfast they speak of is bread that you can toast.

Reviews.Title: “i booked this thru travelocity...what a joke”
Reviews.Author: calidreamin_64
Reviews.Content: i checked in........everyttthing paid for......i work early in the morning, at 8pm.....i get endless calls from the office. Finally i answer it...office tells me travelocity says i haven/t paid. needless to say....i was pissed. I go down to the office and show them my reciepts and id AND CC. They tell me i need to get ahold of travelocity. I called them 3 times, with no answers keep saying they will call me back. The next day i email travelocity, and they send me an email saying they have nothing documented that there was ever a problem with my booking. I'm not sure which company started this, but everything about the booking has been a lie from travelocity. including amenities and the star level of the hotel. I personally will never book with travelocity, or days inn ever again

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were better than expected.. Pool was very nice..”
Reviews.Author: mcat1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Days Inn.. The room was very large.. the Bed was a King and very comfortable.. The hotel was minutes away from the beach and had a very good pizza place and small store across the street.. Plus the hotel was very easy to get to on/off the highway. The pool was clean and inviting. The free continental breakfast was great to start the day.. Only minutes to San Diego and other areas of interest.. I would stay here again. Also there is a Drive-in movie theater 100 feet from the hotel.. Lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “a lot for the money”
Reviews.Author: weezergirl
Reviews.Content: my friend and I stayed here going to and coming out of Mexico; this isn't a glitzy part of SD but we wanted to be close to the border; you can take a local bus easily to the border from here. The staff were the highlight; Muki the owner and Hector the manager were so very helpful and professional, we were very impressed. And this was one of the best nightly rates we found in CA. Imperial Beach close by is one of SD's best kept secrets; very nice; lovely pier. We'd stay here again. And the pizza joint across the street has great cheap pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected from the reviews”
Reviews.Author: sullific
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen by someone else. We needed one near to Imperial Beach, and the one we had stayed at before was no longer there. After this was mentioned to me I checked, as always, on Trip Advisor and I was not happy. But, to be fair, the place isn't as bad as some of these reviews make it sound. It was clean, and quiet, and the breakfast wasn't great but was certainly more than some slices of stale bread or whatever a previous review said...it was comparable to other continental affairs in chain motels - hot and cold cereals, toast, English muffins, Danish pastry, juices and tea and coffee, maybe fruit (I don't recall as I don't take the fruit). Although it was too chilly to use the pool it looked well-kept and clean. The landscaping, what there is of it, was neat, trim and attractive - flowers, palms, manicured lawn. The negatives can be summed up as such: - Neighbourhood isn't great. Not really down, but a little dicey looking here and there. It wasn't enough to scare me, however...I didn't intend to go wandering. -Service is spotty. I needed a phone book for a local number and there was no book in the room, so I went downstairs and asked. I was told the book might be by the t.v., not the phone; the desk clerk told me he didn't have one (as he flipped through something that looked an awful lot like one to prove that to me). Why he didn't just offer to look the number up for me (online or whatever he does) was beyond me. When I returned later and told him no, there was no phone book by the t.v. or anywhere, he offered to have a book sent up to the room. I told him I was going out then and needed the number before I left, so there was no use in sending a book up. If there were books available, why didn't he just give me one the first time? I ended up looking up the number in a weatherworn book hanging from one of the last remaining pay phones on the planet in front of a 7-11 on Palm Avenue...the next day, however, when I went down in need of something, it was the owner at the desk. What a difference. He was almost military in his yes-ma'am-immediately! demeanor. If he'd been on when I needed the phone number, I wouldn't have been squinting and fighting the sea breeze with the book. - Weird Microwave Setup. The room had a fridge and microwave, both very clean. However, the microwave was not plugged in and in no way would reach the outlet from its perch on the t.v. We had to actually move the microwave at least five feet and crawl to get the thing plugged in. There was some graffiti on the bathroom wall which it was obvious they had tried to remove and traces of it remained. Otherwise the room was quite clean. For the price paid, this was not a bad deal. I give the negatives in detail so that you can see they aren't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: traveler2009067
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty, day shift clerk was uninterested, then there was only one towel (the clerk said they keep them in the office because people steal them), breakfast was a few pieces of bread laid out next to a toaster and some coffee warmed up from the night before. Sirens heard all night long. Pick a different place.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, dank, dirty - YUCK!!”
Reviews.Author: PaperDollLV
Reviews.Content: This is for the Days Inn on 1101 Hollister St. The hotel looks run-down and seems to be poorly maintained. The first room they gave me had painting tarps all over the floor, it was in the middle of being painted!! There wasn't even any furniture in the room!! The second room, which unfortunately, we did take because it was almost midnight, was a major disappointment!! The room is dank and musty. The beds are so hard, it would be softer to sleep on the floor. I killed 2 spiders. The walls have poorly patched sections. The toilet is filthy! The curtains are filthy and the heater blows up through them, so you get the smell/stink of the curtains blown into the room! We have reservations for several nights, but, we are cancelling them in the morning and definitely looking for a NICE hotel, which this is not.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IC4U
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience -- had to move three times in the first night. A water pipe had burst, we were not warned about that, and my daughter unknowingly took a bath in unclean water. The second room, though supposedly non-smoking, reeked of cigarettes. The third room smelled sour, like fish, but we were exhausted and needed sleep. We didn't get much because of the noise all night. The room above us was squeaky whenever the people walked around. If someone walked by our room, it shook as if by an earthquake. Although we were given a discount on the two nights, we will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Sweets786
Reviews.Content: I thought I already wrote a review for this hotel, but it's not here so I'll do it again. I loved it! Check-in & out was incredibly simple. Wireless was free and when we had a problem, it was fixed right away. My only complaint is that it is far from the city, but it is very close to Mexico if you want to go to Tijuana. The rental car came in handy because there is parking at the last US exit and you definitely needed it to head to northern San Diego. You must get a car, but parking is included, the room is very nice for personal or business, and great TV.

HotelInfo.Name: San Diego Days Inn (Hollister)
HotelInfo.Address: 1101 Hollister Street, I-5 South Coronado Avenue, San Diego, CA 92154
